description.narrative: 2. The protective environment is strengthened in line with international standards for child victims, witnesses and offenders a. The draft and existing legislation on children in contact with the law are reviewed (relevant codes, laws and by-laws on probation, diversion, alternative sentencing, etc.) to identify gaps with international standards and practices and areas for strengtheningb. Key stakeholders agree on the feasibility, format and key directions of a medium term policy document or strategy that addresses child's rights and their protectionc. Consultations with key stakeholders and experts on strategic visioning for children in contact with the law result in identification of key priorities, components and directions of the policy document/ strategyd. Key stakeholders can access a medium-term policy document/ strategy on advancing Justice for Children, which contributes to Access To Justice, Evaluation And Research, Justice For Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2: Children, especially those in difficult life circumstances, suffer, witness and practice less psychological and physical maltreatment, including all forms of harm, abuse, neglect, and exploitation at home, in school, in care, in custody and in public spaces.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2. The protective environment is strengthened in line with international standards for child victims, witnesses and offenders a. The draft and existing legislation on children in contact with the law are reviewed (relevant codes, laws and by-laws on probation, diversion, alternative sentencing, etc.) to identify gaps with international standards and practices and areas for strengtheningb. Key stakeholders agree on the feasibility, format and key directions of a medium term policy document or strategy that addresses child’s rights and their protectionc. Consultations with key stakeholders and experts on strategic visioning for children in contact with the law result in identification of key priorities, components and directions of the policy document/ strategyd. description.narrative: Building on the outcomes of UNICEF and EU programme to strengthen justice for children, in 2019, Ministry of Interior introduced the medical and social record endorsed by the Law on introducing amendments to the child protection legislative acts. The medical and social record creates an opportunity to strengthen inter-sector coordination at the local level between health, education, law enforcement and social services. Currently, over 8,000 of families in difficult life situations and 13,000 children are registered by municipalities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2020

title.narrative: Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms
